parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Roads and Airports </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Find the road segments connected to the given road segment.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Important </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Pedestrian roads such as <tt>"TRAIL"</tt>s are missing connection information by design, therefore basic command will return empty array for those. Use alternative syntax to return pedestrian roads (available since Arma 3 v1.99.146461) </value></part></template>  </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''roadsConnectedTo''' roadSegment </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> roadSegment: [[Object]] - road segment </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] of [[Object]]s - connected road segments</value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>s2 </name>=<value> [[roadsConnectedTo]] [roadSegment, extended] &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <i>(Since Arma 3 v1.99.146461)</i> </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p21 </name>=<value> [roadSegment, extended] - [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value> 
</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> roadSegment: [[Object]] - road segment </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value> 
</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> extended (Optional): [[Boolean]] - when [[true]] performs more thorough search on top of base behaviour, slower but returns pedestrian and other missing road segments. Default: [[false]] - base behaviour </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER23</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Array]] of [[Object]]s - connected road segments</value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_road = ([[player]] [[nearRoads]] 50) [[select]] 0;
_connectedRoads = [[roadsConnectedTo]] _road;</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_road = ([[player]] [[nearRoads]] 50) [[select]] 0;
_connectedRoadsIncPedestrian = [[roadsConnectedTo]] [_road, [[true]]];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value> 

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[nearRoads]], [[isOnRoad]], [[roadAt]], [[surfaceIsWater]], [[getRoadInfo]], [[nearestTerrainObjects]]   </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>
